sentence.Network_en: I like the openness and directness of northerners.
sentence.Network_cn: 我喜欢北方人的豪爽和直率。

sentence.Network_en: He spread his palms in a gesture of openness.
His classic boyish looks seemed to proclaim his good humour and openness.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的长相非常孩子气,显得性情很好且诚实坦率.

entry.def: If you open something such as a door, window, or lid, or if it opens, its position is changed so that it no longer covers a hole or gap.

example.ex: He opened the window and looked out...
example.tran: 他打开窗户往外看。

example.ex: The church doors would open and the crowd would surge out.
example.tran: 教堂的门会打开，人群会蜂拥而出。

entry.tran: 将（瓶、盒等）开封；拆开（包裹、信封等）
entry.def: If you open something such as a bottle, box, parcel, or envelope, you move, remove, or cut part of it so you can take out what is inside.

example.ex: The Inspector opened the packet of cigarettes...
example.tran: 检查员撕开了那包香烟。

example.ex: The capsules are fiddly to open.
example.tran: 这些胶囊得小心翼翼地打开。

entry.def: If you open something such as a book, an umbrella, or your hand, or if it opens, the different parts of it move away from each other so that the inside of it can be seen.

example.ex: He opened the heavy Bible...
example.tran: 他翻开那本厚厚的《圣经》。

example.ex: She opens her umbrella, and walks up River Street...
example.tran: 她撑开伞，沿着河街向前走。

entry.def: If you open a computer file, you give the computer an instruction to display it on the screen.

example.ex: Double click on the icon to open the file.
example.tran: 双击图标打开文件。

entry.def: When you open your eyes or your eyes open, you move your eyelids upwards, for example when you wake up, so that you can see.

example.ex: When I opened my eyes I saw a man with an axe standing at the end of my bed...
example.tran: 我睁开眼睛时，看见一个手持斧头的男人站在床尾。

example.ex: His eyes were opening wide.
example.tran: 他双眼圆睁。

entry.def: If you open your arms, you stretch them wide apart in front of you, usually in order to put them round someone.

example.ex: She opened her arms and gave me a big hug.
example.tran: 她张开双臂，紧紧地拥抱了我。

entry.def: If you stand or sit in an open way, the front of your body is fully exposed and you are not bending forward or at an angle to someone.

example.ex: Good listeners even sit in an open way: relaxed, arms loose...
example.tran: 善于倾听的人甚至坐姿也很坦荡端正：身体放松，双臂自然下垂。

example.ex: I play normal bunker shots with an open stance.
example.tran: 我打一般的沙坑球采取开立击球姿势。

entry.tran: 坦率的；诚恳的；不作伪的
entry.def: If you describe a person or their character as open, you mean they are honest and do not want or try to hide anything or to deceive anyone.

example.ex: He had always been open with her and she always felt she would know if he lied...
example.tran: 他对她总是坦诚相待，她也一直觉得如果他说谎，自己一定能察觉。

example.ex: She has an open, trusting nature.
example.tran: 她天性坦诚，对人信赖。

entry.def: If you describe a situation, attitude, or way of behaving as open, you mean it is not kept hidden or secret.

example.ex: The action is an open violation of the Vienna Convention...
example.tran: 该行为公然违背了《维也纳公约》。

example.ex: Hearing the case in open court is only one part of the judicial process.
example.tran: 公开审理这一案件只是司法程序的一部分。

entry.tran: 愿意接受（建议、观点等）的；虚怀若谷的
entry.def: If you are open to suggestions or ideas, you are ready and willing to consider or accept them.

example.ex: They are open to suggestions on how working conditions might be improved.
example.tran: 他们愿意就如何改善工作条件听取各种意见。

entry.tran: 容易招致（滥用、批评等）的；易受（攻击）的
entry.def: If you say that a system, person, or idea is open to something such as abuse or criticism, you mean they might receive abuse or criticism because of their qualities, effects, or actions.

example.ex: The system, though well-meaning, is open to abuse...
example.tran: 该制度动机虽好，却易遭滥用。

example.ex: They left themselves wide open to accusations of double standards and hypocrisy.
example.tran: 他们使自己陷于被人指责搞双重标准和虚伪不实的境地。

entry.tran: 悬而未决的；尚未决定的
entry.def: If you say that a fact or question is open to debate, interpretation, or discussion, you mean that people are uncertain whether it is true, what it means, or what the answer is.

example.ex: The truth of the facts produced may be open to doubt...
example.tran: 所摆出事实的真实性仍然值得怀疑。

example.ex: It is an open question how long that commitment can last.
example.tran: 这一承诺能维持多久还不确定。

entry.tran: 开放（被封的道路、边界等）；开通
entry.def: If people open something such as a blocked road or a border, or if it opens, people can then pass along it or through it.

example.ex: The rebels have opened the road from Monrovia to the Ivory Coast...
example.tran: 叛乱分子已经开放了从蒙罗维亚到象牙海岸的道路。

example.ex: The solid rank of police officers lining the courtroom opened to let them pass.
example.tran: 把法庭围得水泄不通的一队警察让开一条路让他们通过。

entry.def: If a place opens into another, larger place, you can move from one directly into the other.

example.ex: The corridor opened into a low smoky room.
example.tran: 这条走廊通向一间烟雾弥漫的低矮房间。

entry.def: An open area is a large area that does not have many buildings or trees in it.

example.ex: Officers will also continue their search of nearby open ground.
example.tran: 警察还将继续在附近的开阔地带搜寻。

entry.tran: 敞开的；无遮盖的；无围挡的
entry.def: An open structure or object is not covered or enclosed.

example.ex: Don't leave a child alone in a room with an open fire.
example.tran: 房间里有裸露的明火时，不要让孩子独处其中。

example.ex: ...open sandwiches.
example.tran: 单片三明治

entry.def: An open wound is one from which a liquid such as blood is coming.

entry.tran: 把（衣服）解开；把…的拉链拉开
entry.def: If you open your shirt or coat, you undo the buttons or pull down the zip.

example.ex: I opened my coat and let him see the belt.
example.tran: 我解开外衣，让他看那条皮带。

entry.def: When a shop, office, or public building opens or is opened, its doors are unlocked and the public can go in.

example.ex: Banks closed on Friday afternoon and did not open again until Monday morning.
example.tran: 银行星期五下午关门，直到星期一上午才营业。

example.ex: ...a gang of three who'd apparently been lying in wait for him to open the shop.
example.tran: 显然一直潜伏着等待他打开店门营业的3人团伙

entry.tran: 为（大楼、工厂、公司等）举行揭幕典礼；开设；开办；开张
entry.def: When a public building, factory, or company opens or when someone opens it, it starts operating for the first time.

example.ex: The original station opened in 1754...
example.tran: 最初的车站于1754年落成。

example.ex: The complex opens to the public tomorrow...
example.tran: 这幢综合大楼将于明天对公众开放。

entry.def: If something such as a meeting or series of talks opens, or if someone opens it, it begins.

example.ex: ...an emergency session of the Russian Parliament due to open later this morning...
example.tran: 将于今天上午晚些时候召开的俄罗斯议会紧急会议

example.ex: They are now ready to open negotiations.
example.tran: 他们现在已经准备好开始谈判。

entry.def: If an event such as a meeting or discussion opens with a particular activity or if a particular activity opens an event, that activity is the first thing that happens or is dealt with. You can also say that someone such as a speaker or singer opens by doing a particular thing.

example.ex: The service opened with a hymn...
example.tran: 礼拜仪式从唱圣歌开始。

example.ex: She opened with an impressive version of 'I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For'...
example.tran: 她以一首优美动人的《我仍在寻找》开场。

entry.def: On the stock exchange, the price at which currencies, shares, or commodities open is their value at the start of that day's trading.

example.ex: Gold declined $2 in Zurich to open at 385.50...
example.tran: 苏黎世的金价下挫2美元，以385.50元开盘。

example.ex: In Paris and Milan, the dollar opened almost unchanged.
example.tran: 在巴黎和米兰，美元开市时几乎没有变化。

entry.def: When a film, play, or other public event opens, it begins to be shown, be performed, or take place for a limited period of time.

example.ex: A photographic exhibition opens at the Royal College of Art on Wednesday...
example.tran: 星期三一个摄影展在皇家艺术学院开幕。

example.ex: This show, too, was virtually sold out before it opened.
example.tran: 这场演出的门票也是几乎在开演前就销售一空了。

entry.def: If you open an account with a bank or a commercial organization, you begin to use their services.

example.ex: He tried to open an account at the branch of his bank nearest to his workplace.
example.tran: 他想在自己银行离工作单位最近的网点开一个账户。

entry.tran: （机会、选择等）可利用的，可得到的
entry.def: If an opportunity or choice is open to you, you are able to do a particular thing if you choose to.

example.ex: There are a wide range of career opportunities open to young people.
example.tran: 年轻人有各种职业选择机会。

entry.tran: （使）（机会、可能性等）出现;（使）产生
entry.def: To open opportunities or possibilities means the same as to open them up.

example.ex: The chief of naval operations wants to open opportunities for women in the Navy...
example.tran: 美国海军作战部长希望能为女兵提供机会。

example.ex: A series of fortunate opportunities opened to him.
example.tran: 很多好机会陆续向他招手。

entry.tran: 人人可以参加（或接受）的；开放的
entry.def: You can use open to describe something that anyone is allowed to take part in or accept.

example.ex: A recent open meeting of College members revealed widespread dissatisfaction...
example.tran: 最近的一次学会成员公开会上，大家普遍流露出不满情绪。

example.ex: A portfolio approach would keep entry into the managerial profession open and flexible.
example.tran: 项目组合的方法会使成为管理人员的机会公开灵活。

entry.tran: （提议等）有效的；（职位等）空缺的，可申请的
entry.def: If something such as an offer or job is open, it is available for someone to accept or apply for.

example.ex: The offer will remain open until further notice.
example.tran: 该提议仍然有效，直到另行通知。

entry.def: If you do something in the open, you do it out of doors rather than in a house or other building.

example.ex: Many are sleeping in the open because they have no shelter.
example.tran: 很多人因为没有栖身之所，只好露宿在外。

entry.def: If an attitude or situation is in the open or out in the open, people know about it and it is no longer kept secret.

example.ex: The medical service had advised us to keep it a secret, but we wanted it in the open.
example.tran: 这家医疗机构建议我们保密，而我们却想公开此事。

entry.tran: 大开的；敞开的；（眼睛）睁大的
entry.def: If something is wide open, it is open to its full extent.

example.ex: The child had left the inner door wide open.
example.tran: 这个孩子将里面的门大敞着。

entry.tran: （比赛、选举等）结果不确定的，胜负难定的
entry.def: If you say that a competition, race, or election is wide open, you mean that anyone could win it, because there is no competitor who seems to be much better than the others.

example.ex: The competition has been thrown wide open by the absence of the world champion.
example.tran: 由于世界冠军缺阵，这场比赛变得胜负难定。

means.word_mean: 1. without obstructions to passage or view;
2. characterized by an attitude of ready accessibility (especially about one's actions or purposes); not secretive
3. willingness or readiness to receive (especially impressions or ideas);

sentences.sentence: "he was testing the government's receptiveness to reform"
"this receptiveness is the key feature is oestral behavior, enabling natural mating to occur"

auth_sentence.content: Royal Charter that they would support openness and tranparency.
auth_sentence.res_content: Royal Charter that they would support openness and tranparency.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Royal Charter that they would support openness and tranparency.

auth_sentence.content: I'm very creative, which requires much openness.
auth_sentence.res_content: I'm very creative, which requires much openness.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I'm very creative, which requires much openness.

auth_sentence.content: That openness was copied into many electronic health-record systems.
auth_sentence.res_content: That openness was copied into many electronic health-record systems.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That openness was copied into many electronic health-record systems.

sentences.en: her openness about her marital problems
sentences.cn: 她对自己婚姻问题的坦率

sentences.en: He demonstrated an openness to change.
sentences.cn: 他显出了对变革的开明态度。

sentences.en: He spread his palms in a gesture of openness.
His classic boyish looks seemed to proclaim his good humour and openness.
sentences.cn: 他的长相非常孩子气，显得性情很好且诚实坦率。
